featured.text: For them, the onion was not just food or medicine; it held significant 32 meaning.
The old sages always used to say that laughter was the best medicine—indeed, better than medicine.
You can also take medicine before your ride to avoid or reduce nausea and vomiting.
A second kind of medicine is called “natural cures,” or “folk medicine,” in which less educated people try to cure sicknesses with various herbs.

other.text: The plant was considered sacred by the ancient Aztecs, and modern-day Mexicans eat it, drink it, and even use it in medicines and shampoos.
For laughter is good medicine That helps to cheer the heart.
Jonathan had qualified as a doctor but later gave up the of medicine for full-time writing.
The success of folk medicine led to the development of doctor medicine.
One is called “doctor medicine,” or “scientific medicine.”
If you mistreat your body by keeping bad habits, 33 symptoms of illness, and ignoring common health rules, even the best medicine can be of little use.
When taking medicine, we should read the instructions on the ______ carefully because they provide important information such as how and when to take it.
Colds are caused by viruses, not bacteria, so taking medicine is absolutely no use at all.
The medicine you take for a cold may cause _____; try not to drive after you take it.
Folk medicine flourished long before the development of scientific medicine and was more successful in ancient times than doctor medicine.
Laughter (40) is the best medicine, so why not give yourself a treat?
According to the article, which of the following is TRUE about medicines for colds? (A) They can cure the common cold.
This kind of medicine is believed to date from the 4th century BC.

definition.zh_def: 用於治療或預防疾病的物質或藥物。
definition.en_def: A substance used for the treatment or prevention of disease.
definition.example: She took her medicine every morning to stay healthy.
